verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> upon Gittith <WH1665>, A Psalm of Asaph <WH623>. Sing aloud <WH7442> unto God <WH430> our strength <WH5797>: make a joyful noise <WH7321> unto the God <WH430> of Jacob <WH3290>. of Asaph: or, for Asaph
Take <WH5375> a psalm <WH2172>, and bring <WH5414> hither the timbrel <WH8596>, the pleasant <WH5273> harp <WH3658> with the psaltery <WH5035>.
Blow up <WH8628> the trumpet <WH7782> in the new moon <WH2320>, in the time appointed <WH3677>, on our solemn feast <WH2282> day <WH3117>.
For this was a statute <WH2706> for Israel <WH3478>, and a law <WH4941> of the God <WH430> of Jacob <WH3290>.

This he ordained <WH7760> in Joseph <WH3084> for a testimony <WH5715>, when he went out <WH3318> through the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>: where I heard <WH8085> a language <WH8193> that I understood <WH3045> not. through: or, against
I removed <WH5493> his shoulder <WH7926> from the burden <WH5447>: his hands <WH3709> were delivered <WH5674> from the pots <WH1731>. were: Heb. passed away

Thou calledst <WH7121> in trouble <WH6869>, and I delivered <WH2502> thee; I answered <WH6030> thee in the secret place <WH5643> of thunder <WH7482>: I proved <WH974> thee at the waters <WH4325> of Meribah <WH4809>. Selah <WH5542>. Meribah: or, Strife
Hear <WH8085>, O my people <WH5971>, and I will testify <WH5749> unto thee: O Israel <WH3478>, if thou wilt hearken <WH8085> unto me;
There shall no strange <WH2114> god <WH410> be in thee; neither shalt thou worship <WH7812> any strange <WH5236> god <WH410>.
I am the LORD <WH3068> thy God <WH430>, which brought <WH5927> thee out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>: open thy mouth <WH6310> wide <WH7337>, and I will fill <WH4390> it.
But my people <WH5971> would not hearken <WH8085> to my voice <WH6963>; and Israel <WH3478> would <WH14> none of me.
So I gave them up <WH7971> unto their own hearts' <WH3820> lust <WH8307>: and they walked <WH3212> in their own counsels <WH4156>. unto: or, to the hardness of their hearts, or, imagination
Oh <WH3863> that my people <WH5971> had hearkened <WH8085> unto me, and Israel <WH3478> had walked <WH1980> in my ways <WH1870>!
I should soon <WH4592> have subdued <WH3665> their enemies <WH341>, and turned <WH7725> my hand <WH3027> against their adversaries <WH6862>.

The haters <WH8130> of the LORD <WH3068> should have submitted <WH3584> themselves unto him: but their time <WH6256> should have endured for ever <WH5769>. submitted: or, yielded feigned obedience: Heb. lied
He should have fed <WH398> them also with the finest <WH2459> of the wheat <WH2406>: and with honey <WH1706> out of the rock <WH6697> should I have satisfied <WH7646> thee. finest: Heb. fat of wheat
